medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe fatigue, myalgia, diarrhea, dry mouth, and weight loss of 23 kg.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in September 2004, shortly before referral for evaluation, with marked fatigue and weight loss. The patient experienced a worsening of fatigue and myalgia one week later, and developed fever and dermatomal zoster.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with HIV infection in 1998 with an initial CD4 count of 20 cells/mL. History of poor adherence to antiretroviral therapy due to alcoholism, hospitalization in 1999 for severe Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia, and previous treatment with zidovudine, lamivudine, and indinavir. Developed severe anemia requiring a change in medication. Also has diabetes mellitus and is infected with hepatitis C.
